image.altText: Black and white photograph of a man playing the guitar with long hair

items.synopsis: Crispin Dye's case, which was due to be revisited today at an inquiry, has now been delayed after a judge described NSW Police record keeping as "borderline shambolic".

title.children: New evidence about brutal death of AC/DC manager uncovered during gay hate inquiry

image.altText: Australian currency is seen next to a wages graph

items.synopsis: The stock market is a few percentage points away from an all-time high because some of Australia's biggest corporations are making record profits. But Australian households are under pressure, writes David Taylor.

title.children: The Reserve Bank has pointed directly to the elephant in the room

image.altText: James Anderson looks frustrated as Usman Khawaja and Scott Boland run next to him

items.synopsis: Play isÂ underway at Edgbaston as Australia and England get set for a potentially thrilling final day of the first Test. Follow all the updates in our live blog.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: There is some concern about the area directly in front of the Hollies stand, which is quite damp. Plenty of hot air coming out of there over the past few days, so perhaps it'll dry quicker if the crowd gets in...
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Play will resume at 11:15pm AEST

children.content: There is some concern about the area directly in front of the Hollies stand, which is quite damp.
Plenty of hot air coming out of there over the past few days, so perhaps it'll dry quicker if the crowd gets in...

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: We've been told there will be no play until at least lunch, which will be taken early at 9:30pm AEST. So there's a bit of time to waste before the action gets underway.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: No play until at least 10:10pm AEST

children.content: We've been told there will be no play until at least lunch, which will be taken early at 9:30pm AEST.
So there's a bit of time to waste before the action gets underway.

image.altText: Collins gestures with one hand while speaking at the despatch box in the House of Representatives.

items.synopsis: The federal government has left open the option of pursuing housing options that will be met with less resistance, after failing to pass its signature $10 billion Housing Australia Future Fund.

title.children: Housing minister won't rule out dumping signature $10b fund in favour of easier paths to building housing

image.altText: Thorpe holds a phone up for Hargraves as he reads a message from it to journalists.

image.altText: A composite image of two men and a woman, separated by paper tears.

image.altText: Three people stand in blizzard at Mount Hotham.

items.synopsis: For the first time in 24 years, Australians are heading to the polls to decide on a change to the constitution. Legislation setting up a referendum on an Indigenous Voice to Parliament passed the Senate on Monday, meaning a referendum has to be held before the end of the year.
